newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products resolutely follow crude downwards.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products resolutely follow crude downwards.

text.p: NWE oil products were weaker on Wednesday.
Naphtha fell around $56 in line with tumbling crude. End-users were relaxed amid plentiful supplies.
Gasoline also lost ground sheding over $10 a tonne. Severe losses in the U.S. of up to $30 a tonne were marginalising the arbitrage opportunities.
Gas oil slid $10.25 on lower futures and cargo and barge premiums were under presure from flat demand.
Fuel oil was lower. Barges losing up to $4, cargoes down $1 or so. Continued weakness was limiting trading activity.
